Job Title: Future Opportunity/Pipeline: Senior Manager-Digital Product Management

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Product Management

Description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.

Please note, this is not an active requisition for an open position. This is to pipeline for future potential openings in 2024.

With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.

At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.

Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.

Where are these roles located within American Express?

The US Consumer Product Management and Lending organization leads company’s efforts to manage our relationships and expand our suite of consumer lending products, bringing deep expertise to deliver products, services, and strategies that will enhance our competitive position in each of our markets.

Our Consumer Product Management and Lending team is constantly working to offer customers across the globe with a full suite of flexible payment options and exceptional experiences, from cobrand and proprietary lending cards to innovative on –and off-card options.

You could be recruited for a role to serve as a key member in several of our working groups. Some of the teams that we are currently hiring for include:

Cobrand Product Management: The Cobrand team delivers meaningful customer experiences to our Card Members by building world class relationships with industry leading partners. With our colleagues across the Blue Box, we drive strong customer engagement to strengthen the value of membership for our partners and Card Members.US Proprietary Lending Products: Our Lending team is responsible for our US proprietary (Amex-branded) credit cards, which typically carry no (or relatively low) annual fees,and provide rewards to customers in the form of Cash Back and Membership Rewards points. We work to design card features and benefits that will uniquely serve our customers’ purchasing, borrowing and lifestyle needs, so they choose to use our cards above others, and our portfolios operate as efficient enterprise investments with optimized economics. We work in close partnership with teams across the blue box (Risk, Marketing, Finance, Technologies, Legal, Servicing, etc.), and are always looking for future team members with a good mix of the following skills: a customer mindset, an understanding of lend economics, analytical insight, marketing, and proposition design and development.Product, Capabilities & Strategic Initiatives: This team delivers the best products and customer experiences, driving the top strategic priorities across the Consumer business. Specifically, the Product Development team leads the cross-functional development of key initiatives like card launches/refreshes, new benefits, and capabilities. The Strategic Engagement team advances critical priorities by deploying versatile talent with expertise in strategy, marketing, and product management. And the Capabilities Planning team centrally leads the planning and prioritization of technology investments, seeking to transform and continually optimize the process to ensure focus on our top business priorities.US Pricing, Lending Treatments & Customer Experience: The team’s mission is to engage our card members in the US by offering best-in-class card product and payment features and off-card borrowing solutions. We win when we have the majority of lend and spend share across our customers’ card and personal loan wallets while meeting our portfolio return expectations. We do so by partnering with teams across the enterprise (Risk, Marketing, Finance, EDDS, Technologies, Legal, Compliance, Servicing, etc.), to innovate and evolve our suite of products, expand our product reach, optimize pricing and offer constructs and enhance the customer experience.

What you will do:

Lead the launch of new Marketing/ Product capabilities and revenue driving treatments.Critical participant in concept development, feasibility assessment, and end-to-end customer experience design.Understand business objectives and customer needs, and identify creative ways to leverage capabilities and develop new solutions to meet those needs.Lead Consumer-wide pivotal initiatives to drive business results, improve customer experiences, and increase agility in product development.Lead intake and assessment of new demand and facilitating trade-off options and decision-making.Continuously improve the investment planning and product development processes to drive greater efficiency, agility, and effectiveness.

What you will bring:

You are solution focused, results-driven, and show up with passion and enthusiasm. You are comfortable working in an innovative and fast-paced environment and can simultaneously drive multiple projects– you are a self-starter, organized, appreciate the details, and hold yourself accountable for delivery.You have excellent communication skills with the ability to engage, influence, and drive principled collaboration and alignment – you know how to get the best from cross-functional partners.Self-starter with track record of excelling in a fast-paced environmentA creative and innovative thinker and problem-solver who can manage effectively through ambiguity and evolving strategies, while maintaining strong customer focusComfort with technology, and skilled at understanding business and customer needs and translating into tech requirementsAbility to understand the details of complex processes with an orientation toward process improvement and innovation, and an ability to translate across teams with various technical capacitiesExcellent understanding of lending and card business drivers; ability to interpret financial information to find opportunities and develop business strategiesExperience with product ownership in an agile or scaled agile delivery environment is a plusYou have a positive attitude and maintain a sense of humor in the face of challenges and/or setbacks.

Salary Range: $90,000.00 to $165,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits

The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:

Competitive base salaries Bonus incentives 6% Company Match on retirement savings plan Free financial coaching and financial well-being support Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need 20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location) Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program Career development and training opportunities

For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

US Job Seekers/Employees - Click here to view the “Know Your Rights” poster and the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.

If the links do not work, please copy and paste the following URLs in a new browser window: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters to access the three posters.

Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
